alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Lunenburg; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:32PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Lunenburg, Nottoway, western Dinwiddie and northwestern Brunswick Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 231 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Spainville to Blackstone to near Kenbridge. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Blackstone around 235 PM EDT. Wilsons and Spainville around 250 PM EDT. Fort Barfoot around 305 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include North Wellville, Irby, Gills Corner, Murdocks, Forkland, Darvills, The Falls, Church Road, Wellville and Dominy Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and south central Virginia.
